comments: now make for two flavors of VANILLA as a layout system
add VANILLA as a layout system
ALL entries will be grouped and start with name of format, such as 'POEM
NOTHING IN HERE will be specific to any project
For HTML, we have to manually make a table of contents(see documentation below)

Static front material is for each web page
Table of contents are only the heading (one string)
rest are created from the MANIFEST information

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE html
PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
<!-- start static header content -->
<head>
<!-- COMMENT NO EXTERNAL ACCESS, this page is for offline reading -->
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html"/>
<meta name="Author" content="PROJECT_AUTHOR"/>
 PROJECT_COPYRIGHT
<!-- hard-code CSS, not this <link rel="STYLESHEET" href="PROJECT_HTML_CSS"/> -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="poem.css"/>
<script type="text/javascript" src="poem.js"> <!-- for layout -->
<!-- must be full tag set to work with IE 6 --></script>
<title>PROJECT_TITLE</title>
<meta name="keywords" content="
 PROJECT_KEYWORDS
<meta name="description" content="PROJECT_DESCRIPTION"/>
<meta name="EPB-UUID" content="PROJECT_ISBN"/>
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"/>
<script type="text/javascript" src="utility.js">
<!-- must be full tag set to work with IE 6 -->
</script>
<!-- override POEM settings and add special items for our use -->
<style type="text/css">
a
  {
  font-size: 80%; 
  /* font-size: 110%; */
  }
  a.seealso
  {
  font-size: 100%;  /* inline no special size */
  }
p.caption
  {
   clear:left; 
   font-size: 80%; 
   font-style: italic;
  }
</style>
TTOCC
<!-- google analytics SCRIPTS would be here -->
</head>
<body>
<!-- boilerplate for top of webpage -->
<script type="text/javascript" >
    write_controls1();
</script>
<!-- DO NOT encase title in Javascript, let it be found by search engines -->
<script type="text/javascript" >
    write_controls2('Updated PROJECT_PUBLISH_DATE');
</script>
<!-- end poem static header content -->

TOCcomments: Table of contents are only the heading (one string)
all entries are created from the MANIFEST, not from here

POEM: This is a version of the PROJECT_TYPE for use in a web browser. As such, this PROJECT_TYPE is a completely
self-contained, interactive product, just as if you were reading a website.
The 'index' links within the document point to both a Table of Contents and all document indexes, if present.
The PROJECT_TYPE is meant to be read in any order, with
no specific flow, but since this web page is a single HTML file,
most content will flow downward from the beginning.
With your web browser, you have complete control to move 'back' through your reading pathway. This is not
the same as an EPUB or PDF document, which have a specific flow from page to page. Both the indexes and Table
of Contents are made up of links that will send you to the appropriate text or illustration.

The font and layout were designed to work with computer screens, phones, and tablets. The viewer may not always get the ideal font size, depending on the device used. Just use the buttons at the top of each page to make the text larger or smaller.
The illustrations seen in-line are smaller thumbnails of the full illustrations.
Clicking on a thumbnail activates a pop-up window with a higher-quality illustration.
Use of this feature requires that you configure your browser to 'allow pop-up
windows'. The method of enabling this feature differs with each browser type.
<!-- end of page, but no POEM termination  -->
